Songha Ban

SW Engineer | Dancer | Traveller

About Me

Hi! My name is Songha Ban, and I am a Bachelor's CSAI(Cognitive Science & Artificial Intelligence) student at Tilburg University.

A major part of my studies is focused on computing skills, big data and the understanding of the ethical and moral aspects of artificial intelligence in society. Beyond the curriculum, I am developing techniques in the field of machine learning by reviewing papers, participating in hackathons, and working on some toy projects. My current research interest is in image processing and motion generation.

I have been working as a Jr. Software engineer for over two years at an AI-based security company in South Korea. During the semester, I work part-time remotely, and during the summer, I work fulltime back in South Korea. Because a lot of projects are about big data, I use Python most of the time. My jobs include, but are not limited to, crawling and analyzing data, doing research, developing APIs, and managing AWS services.

I also love dancing, travelling, singing, and making videos, which empower me to express myself and visualize my values. Currently, I am dancing as a member of Uni-T, a student hip hop dance team in Tilburg.
